p:
Zika virus is a mosquitoborne flavivirus associated with several recent outbreaks in human populations in the Pacific region and the Americas. Phylogeographic studies indicate that Zika virus strains circulating in South Pacific islands and Latin America comprise a single lineage (ZIKV SP-AM) that arose because of sequential single viral disseminations from Southeast Asia into French Polynesia and from the South Pacific into Latin America (
1 â€“
5 ). However, whether the ancestral Zika virus strain introduced into the Americas arose directly from French Polynesia or from another South Pacific island is unclear.
